intro: Vincetoxicum eurychiton, commonly known as the yellow woodbine, is a perennial climbing plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces elliptical, woody fruits that contain seeds covered in a sticky, resinous substance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Due to its toxic properties, it should be handled with care.
